Quora-093211.full_text: EARLY in the day. Why?. Because the early hours of the day are the optimal time for your analytical brain to perform the most complex tasks (in the case of studying, these can be reading, comprehension, application, repetition). Some scientists call this time of day the brain’s peak performance time, and it's roughly 2-4 hours after we wake up. So, for example, if you wake up at 6, your peak times for learning are between 8 and 10 a.m. You can extend this time until midday so that you cover the most important concepts by lunchtime.

sentences: Dopamine levels and the structure of dopamine receptors underlie this temperament difference between Introverts and Extraverts (On the Psychobiology of Personality).
Quora-237717.full_text: Dopamine levels and the structure of dopamine receptors underlie this temperament difference between Introverts and Extraverts (On the Psychobiology of Personality). In broad strokes, Introverts have high baseline levels of cognitive stimulation and arousal even at rest and thus are constantly trying to avoid any additional visual and social stimuli. So when they're trying to concentrate, nearby noises or people are additional stimuli that becomes distracting and pushes them over their optimal level of arousal. Extraverts, on the other hand, are at a constant arousal deficit and require extra stimuli to compensate and bring them to their optimal level. So they seek out places with lots of people, loud music, or interesting visuals.
short_answers: Dopamine levels and the structure of dopamine receptors

The only reasons I can imagine why you'd think there's any controversy are:You may have heard the term “abstract nonsense”. This is a light-hearted, tongue-in-cheek reference to the universal aspect of category theory. It doesn't signify a controversy regarding either the validity or the significance of any category-theoretic argument. It takes some care to set up the set-theoretic foundations of category theory, which naively deals with proper classes such as “the category of all groups”. sentences: Obsessive-compulsive disorder, or OCD, is an anxiety disorder that generally causes extreme discomfort.
Quora-281830.full_text: Obsessive-compulsive disorder, or OCD, is an anxiety disorder that generally causes extreme discomfort. Sufferers are often riddled with persistent and recurrent impulses, thoughts and images that are unwanted. According to the National Institute for Mental Health, OCD affects more than 2million adults in the United States. Severe cases of OCD can cause an extreme amount of distress, and the disorder can dramatically interfere with a person’s daily life. Sufferers of OCD are generally very anxious and emotional. They display many non- OCD symptoms, such as signs of depression, excessive worry,extreme tension, and the constant feeling that nothing is ever right. Aside from the obvious compulsive behaviors a person with OCD displays, there are no physical signs of this disorder; however, a person with OCD can develop physical problems. For example, a person with a germ obsession may wash their hands so much that the skin on them becomes red, raw and painful. A person with OCD may experience multiple short-term effects, including the inability to function as a contributing member of society, difficulties at school or work,or trouble maintaining friendships or romantic relationships. The long-term effects of OCD generally develop due to the poor quality of life that most extreme sufferers have. Long-term effects include depression, constant anxiety and an increased risk of substance abuse.

This is not me being a jerk; I try to do this at least once a year on my production systems. At the end of the day, there is no optimization like a fresh install. And, as @Ivan said, ZEALOUSLY try to keep the garbage off the system for as long as you can. If you don't need it, don't install it. Here's the thing: Windows has gotten a LOT better about isolating installations properly and cleaning up after uninstallations... but at the end of the day careless developers are careless developers -- big software houses and small. These "artifacts" add up, and that -- as well as unnecessarily running background processes and settings that you may have never intended to change -- are what causes the system to become sluggish. The best way to guard against this is to pay attention to what you are installing and, even then, to install "responsibly". My golden rule? Uninstall anything that you have the media for and that you don't use at least once a month. And do your best to stay away from the pirated stuff.

sentences: In addition to the "humans and apes evolved from a common ancestor" answer, which is the key point, there's another misconception to tease out here: that evolution is a series of "X is replaced by Y" steps.
Quora-267452.full_text: In addition to the "humans and apes evolved from a common ancestor" answer, which is the key point, there's another misconception to tease out here: that evolution is a series of "X is replaced by Y" steps. It isn't. All that's required for a new variant of a species to emerge from an evolutionary process is for that variant to occur and survive over time. That can happen whether the ancestor species sticks around or not. What makes this non-obvious is that most species don't survive long-term; the vast, vast majority of species that have existed on Earth are extinct now. So if you look back, chances are that any given ancestor of any given modern species is long gone. But that's not necessarily because it was replaced per se. Rather, it probably coexisted for quite a long time with its descendant, gradually dying out for whatever reason (possibly, but not necessarily, including being outcompeted for scarce resources -- it's definitely true that competition plays a big role) until only the more recent species remained. Viewed from afar, this looks a bit like "species A transformed into species B" but that's just a conceptual shortcut, not the actual mechanism at work.
short_answers: humans and apes evolved from a common ancestor
another misconception to tease out here: that evolution is a series of "X is replaced by Y" steps. It isn't.

sentences: There is no known proof of Goldbach’s conjecture.
Quora-258647.full_text: There is no known proof of Goldbach’s conjecture. There’s a conjecture known as Goldbach’s weak conjecture, which states that every odd number greater than 5 is the sum of three primes. In 1937, Vinogradov proved that this is true for all sufficiently large odd numbers, and in 2013 Helfgott proved it completely, by lowering the threshold of “sufficiently large” to about 10271027, which is small enough to already have been covered by computer verifications.
